--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
>=
 nt_bdr wrote:
> > I have the scope of the crawl set to SURT Scope. If I ha=
ve the
> > following entry in the seed list - www.xdrive.com. Will the craw=
ler
> > crawl xdrive.com aswell?
> 
> Both the SurtPrefixScope and the Surt=
PrefixedDecideRule (used in a 
> DecidingScope) will convert that seed into=
 an implied SURT prefix that 
> includes the 'www' -- so URLs on 'xdrive.co=
m' or other subdomains of 
> 'xdrive.com' will not be crawled.
> 
> If you =
add a line...
> 
> +xdrive.com
> 
> ...to your seeds file (and are using a =
SURT-based scope that looks for 
> these kind of lines) it will broaden the=
 necessary URL-accepting prefix 
> so that it accepts 'xdrive.com' and all =
subdomains as part of the scope.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>

Thanks for the respo=
nse.
So are you saying, if I add +xdrive.com to the seed instead of
www.xdr=
ive.com, then it will crawl both www.xdrive.com and xdrive.com?
